alert.note: Alert for Garza; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 2:58PM CDT until June 01 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Garza County in northwestern Texas... East Central Lynn County in northwestern Texas... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have moved out of the area. However, widespread flooding of roads including US-84 through Post continues. Runoff from precious rains will continue for quite some time. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Post. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Law enforcement reports numerous road closures in the area including the city of Post. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
